Perfect note taking app doesn't exis… 

Duh!!
The wait is finally over.

Enter Notes. 
A clean and minimal note taking app.

Whether you are a student, engineer, digital nomad, hobbyist or even Elon freakin' Musk, we've all felt the need to take notes at some point or the other. And nothing pisses us off more than installing a note taking app, only to find out that its user interface resembles the launch controls of USS Enterprise spacecraft. (Start Trek reference!) 

Notes app beats all that.
The User Interface is designed to be squeaky clean and buttery smooth. All of this ensures that the nothing stands between you, your thoughts and your phone. 

Not even this app!

Ahoy, for all the night shade lovers. 
I have added a Dark Mode too, to fulfill your "I do some serious shit on my phone. Don't mess with me" fantasy. 

Go, check it out now. 

You will find it in the options menu at the top right corner of your screen.

Start by adding your very first note. 

Can you see that button on bottom right corner of your screen? 

 Yeah, the red one with + sign on it. Don't worry it stays the same in both, Light and Dark mode. 

Click that.
A new page will open where you can enter you're notes. 


Finally press the tick mark at top left corner, when you're done writing you're masterpiece novel.

We need to talk about our plans for the much awaited Goa trip. 

Although our first trip was kind of successful and worth it, we still had to leave out many places, which are yet to be explored. 


That place is not to toured in a 48 hour sprint. We need to take out a couple of days from our schedule and chart out proper and effective plans for all the local road trips to cover andplaces to visit in the city.

To delete any note, just long press on its card, and an alert dialog will be shown asking for your confirmation. 

Beware! 
Deleting any note will permanently delete it from your phone. There is no "Trash", no turning back from whatever you do, at least for now.

To edit any note, first click on its card in the list of notes. 

By default, it will open in View mode, where you can scroll through your note and view the contents.

To enter Edit mode, simply double-tap anywhere on the screen and you will be brought into Edit mode where you can edit the title as well as content of the note.

This app was designed and crafted single-handedly as a hobby project, unlike the other apps in the market which are backed by a team of developers, each perfecting and polishing a niche part of the app. 


There are some features that I will try to implement whenever I get some free time, viz. like Trash, To-Do list, Cloud Backup, etc. 

Your kind support will go a long way in helping me reach all these feature milestones. 

I am always grateful for any feedback you have. 


Please feel free to reach out to me!
